meanings.definition: Extending in scope or effect to a prior time or to conditions that existed or originated in the past.
meanings.sent1: The retroactively approved budget covered expenses from last year.
meanings.sent2: The retroactively applied discount saved me money on my previous purchases.
meanings.sent3: It was funny how the retroactively enforced rule suddenly affected everyone's behavior.
meanings.sent4: Her retroactively altered hairstyle made her look like a character from the past.
meanings.sent5: The retroactively changed traffic laws made driving in the city confusing.

meanings.definition: Taking effect from a date in the past.
meanings.sent1: The retroactively signed contract was binding from the beginning of the project.
meanings.sent2: The retroactively issued permit allowed the event to proceed as planned.
meanings.sent3: The retroactively approved vacation request surprised the employees.
meanings.sent4: His retroactively granted wish felt like a dream come true.
meanings.sent5: The retroactively implemented safety measures prevented accidents in the workplace.
